ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Then when they had both submitted and he had lain him face down on the ground,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When they submitted to the will of God, and (Abraham) laid (his son) down prostrate on his temple,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: When both surrendered (to Allah's command) and Abraham flung the son down on his forehead,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When they both agreed and Abraham had lain down his son on the side of his face (for slaughtering),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then (remember) when they both submitted to Allah’s command, and Ibrahim lay his son facing downwards. (The knife did not hurt Ismail)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then, when they had both submitted themselves, and he had laid him prostrate on his forehead;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So when they both submitted and he threw him down upon his forehead,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: When they had surrendered, and he flung him upon his brow,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then, when they had both surrendered (to Allah), and he had flung him down upon his face,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When they had both submitted to God, and he had laid his son down on his face,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then when the twain had submitted themselves and he had prostrated him upon his temple.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So when they had both surrendered [to Allah’s will], and he had laid him down on his forehead,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: So when they had both submitted their wills (to Allah), and he had laid him prostrate on his forehead (for sacrifice),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then, when they had both submitted themselves (to the Will of Allah), and he had laid him prostrate on his forehead (or on the side of his forehead for slaughtering);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And when they had both submitted, and his son had laid down prostrate upon his forehead,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then, when they had submitted, and he put his forehead down.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And when they had both submitted and he put him down upon his forehead,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:103] And when they had both submitted, [when] they had submitted to and were prepared to comply with God’s command, exalted be He, and he had laid him down on his forehead, [when] he had pushed him down to the ground thereon — every human being has two brows (jabīn) between which is the forehead (jabha); this was at Minā. Abraham passed the knife across his [son’s] throat but it did not do anything, by some impediment of the Divine Power,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then, when they had both surrendered (to Allah)) when they both agreed and consigned the matter to Allah, (and he had flung him down upon his face) and it is said: on his side,
